result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin J OBrien was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
for substitution of attorneys signed by Judge Maxwell.

Defendant Kevin J OBrien in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden appeared, stipulation and order for substitution of attorneys filed.  Attorney Menden is excused.  Amended information filed.  Defendant pleads No Contest to amended charge count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty in count #1.  Defendant pleads Guilty of amended count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Victim makes statements, requesting the no contact order be lifted.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Ehrfurth makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:
Count #1
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
4 months Huber consecutive to count #2 (Credit - 1 day) HUBER WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.
Term of Probation: 2 Years
Conditions of Probation:
Domestic violence counseling / anger management.  
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No violent contact with Melissa C.
Costs: $343.00 to be paid as a condition of probation.  
Condition Time: 30 days huber stayed.  

The Court Orders the Following:
Count #2
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
30 days Huber consecutive to count #1 (Credit - 0 days) HUBER WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.
Term of Probation: 2 Years
Conditions of Probation:
Domestic violence counseling / anger management.  
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No violent contact with Melissa C.
Costs: $343.00 to be paid as a condition of probation.  
Condition Time: 30 days huber stayed.
proposed Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorneys
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
September 29, 2015 jury trial
Jury status hearing on September 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kevin J OBrien in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense presents bail motion arguments.State objects to any modification. Court denied the motion. Bail remains as fixed.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Motion hearing on August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
to modify bail; filed by Atty. Menden
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kevin J OBrien in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden requests a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on June 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kevin J OBrien in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that the witnesses be excluded from the courtroom. Court grants. Officer Timothy Filter from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Officer Andrew McNulty from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects with no arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Anthony Rosario for Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Kevin J OBrien did not appear.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on March 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Kevin J OBrien in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.
